component.name: ButtonGroup
component.description: Visually and functionally group buttons and button-adjacent controls into a single cohesive control surface.

useCases: Creating split buttons with a primary action and a dropdown
Pairing buttons with inputs, selects, dropdowns, or popovers

commonPatterns.name: horizontal-button-group
commonPatterns.description: Standard horizontal grouping of related action buttons

commonPatterns.name: split-button
commonPatterns.description: Primary action paired with a dropdown for secondary actions

commonPatterns.name: button-with-separator
commonPatterns.description: Buttons separated by a visual divider for non-outline variants

commonPatterns.name: vertical-button-group
commonPatterns.description: Vertically stacked group for sidebar or toolbar layouts
commonPatterns.composition:
<ButtonGroup orientation="vertical">
  <Button variant="outline">Option A</Button>
  <Button variant="outline">Option B</Button>
  <Button variant="outline">Option C</Button>
</ButtonGroup>

commonPatterns.name: button-with-text-label
commonPatterns.description: Static text label alongside grouped buttons

antiPatterns.reason: ButtonGroup does not manage selection state
antiPatterns.alternative: Use ToggleGroup for mutually exclusive choices

antiPatterns.reason: ButtonGroup actions execute immediately and do not track selected state
antiPatterns.alternative: Use ToggleGroup or RadioGroup for stateful selection
Place unrelated actions in separate containers

slots.children: Button, Input, InputGroup, Select, DropdownMenu, Popover, ButtonGroupText, ButtonGroupSeparator

subComponents.ButtonGroupText: Static label element with muted background; supports asChild via Radix Slot
subComponents.ButtonGroupSeparator: Visual divider between grouped controls; wraps Separator with vertical orientation by default

interactions.click: Delegated to child controls; ButtonGroup itself is inert

responsive.mobile: Consider vertical orientation for narrow viewports

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Tab navigates between child controls; individual children handle their own keyboard interactions
accessibility.screenReader: Announced as a group; child controls announce their own labels
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus is managed per-child; focused child gets z-index elevation to show focus ring above siblings

rules: ButtonGroup does not manage selection state
Actions inside a ButtonGroup execute immediately
Visual grouping implies related functionality, not shared state
Buttons retain their individual semantic variants inside a ButtonGroup
Separators are recommended for non-outline button variants
Outline buttons do not require separators due to visible borders

aiHints.context: Use ButtonGroup for split buttons and compound controls where multiple related actions sit together. Do not replace ToggleGroup with ButtonGroup when state selection is required. ButtonGroup may wrap non-button controls (Input, Select, Popover) when they participate in a single action cluster.
